result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn L. Donovan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Commit a Battery on Person [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(d).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: to be paid 25% out of prison wages and remaining balance as condition of ES.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.

No contact with L.M.

SAFE program or equivalent.  

AODA and any follow up.  Counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. 

DNA sample.
